They nerfed his lane shout and gave him cinderhulk to shove him into jungle because a tank doing well in a lane is unheard of, then they realized he was already a good jungler and cinderhulk synergizes well with his w passive, so they nerfed not one but two damage abilities. So his clear in both is hit hard, he's still good, I'm just annoyed that he's getting so focused when there's so many more problem children.

If Mundo's getting nerfed, it's because Riot keeps taking Grievous Wounds out of champion's kits, and they don't have a good AD item that does that anymore (you take that out of {{champion:21}}'s kit, and I'm getting the pitchforks and torches ready).  Maokai has had his 15 minutes of fame, and Shen and Singed were knee jerk nerfed a while back in an asinine way (no MR per level, despite Galibro getting AP scaling off his MR, yet still getting scaling.)

As for Sion, you underestimate positioning.  Yeah, if I derp down the lane like a moron, I'm never going to be able to knock anyone up.  But if I come in from behind like the Edelweiss in Valkyria Chronicles, they're not going to be able to react in enough time to get out of the way of my knockup.  And if I ult, well, if you get hit, you're getting stun locked, unless your name is Gangplank or Olaf.

You can use it point blank or from flank, thats its preferred use imo, thats how I use it, but hey if you hit a tank, or if anyone has a blink ability, they will dodge and kite your slow shambling ass. Honestly Sion is a new version of Nasus that no one knows how to combat yet, so the balance team is just chucking nerfs at him until a solution is found and he is inevitably turned to mulch.

That wasn't a "chuck nerf", there was a problem with how efficiently Sion was clearing the jungle as a tank.  I only needed to eat one biscuit as Sion, and I'll be able to sit in jungle until I'm level 6 (would be more if I didn't run OOM), because of how much damage Sion's Q did to jungle monsters on top of being stupidly tanky from the large monster bonuses.  So no, these aren't just random nerfs for the sake of nerfing, they're there for a reason.

Sion's sustain in the jungle was not special.  Since there are so many champions that can sustain themselves indefinitely or at least remain threatening enough to gank after their first clear I would hardly call that a problem specific to Sion.  

If Riot feels like champions shouldn't be able to do that, then they're doing a terrible job balancing things because so many of them already can.  Give me five champions who fit reasonably well within the current jungle meta and I bet I can get them through the jungle without issue, especially with a leash.

Yeah this is what I'm talking about, nidalee can easily clear faster AND sustains more. Sion just has an hp shield. If he gets counterjungled, especially early, his farming goes to shit and he doesnt get tanky. But If everyone is passive, he gets fed and hard to kill, he's just like Nasus.

I agree with your comparison to Nasus, there are a lot of commonalities between the two.  The biggest difference being Sion's kit is a little bit more useful for the team because of the mobility and the hard CC.  Otherwise, I see the community struggling to adapt to both of them because of their scaling.

There is a counter to stacking health in %HP damage, many champions possess this capability or they can buy an item called Blade of the Ruined King.  

They nerfed his mana costs and his damage and now he's a liability in lane.  Do you realize he is one of the squishiest champions at the beginning of the game?  He's squisher than Shaco.  His base defensive stats are so low because his damage and late game potential are all he has going for him.  

Anyone who knows Sion's strengths and weaknesses should know how to completely cripple him in lane.  The guy can't all-in worth anything until he gets 3-4 tank items and a good deal of farm.  Furthermore, all of his abilities are skill-shots and any champion with an ounce of mobility can get out of the way, unless you're in a team fight.  If you're in a team fight before his survivability spikes, you just focus him and you kill him because he is the least useful tank in the game until his power spike, which is half-way through a match.  

When the enemy picks Sion, I can't wait to face him now.  He's a shadow of his former glory and free LP for the other team.
I legitimately think people just cant 'handle sion' cause he's the only tank in the game aside from leona who legitimately feels tanky.

Don't know about you, but I 1v2'd a Nidalee and LeBlanc as Sion at level 4, so you've obviously played against some pretty bad Sions.

Shaco is meant to be an early game champion, so it makes sense that he starts out with higher health than Sion, and the only reason his health scales higher is because Sion has a passive health scaling on unit kill, which as we have learned from Thresh is a pretty big deal despite the scaling penalties that come with it.  So by the time that I back for the first time, I'm already ahead of Shaco in passive health.  Once cinderhulk is built, I'm the tankiest character in the game.

Sion's biggest weakness is his early game.  You need hella good positioning to gank a lane.  He can survive in the jungle extremely well despite the nerfs, so you're pretty much power farming until you hit 6 and start ganking from the tower.  After that, Sion becomes an unstoppable monster if you haven't starved him of farm by counter jungling or shutting him down.  It will take about 10 seconds and all 5 of your team to take down Sion, and that's implying he doesn't knock all of you up or ult to get away.

I am not saying Sion is OP, but I am going to say that you sound like the textbook old Sion whiners that you can't just point and click to blow somebody up with full AP Sion anymore.

I don't want to be distracting you away from my point and I don't know about any specific scenario you have been a part of.  It is no secret Sion scales into his durability over time and with that his weakness is an early game.  

However, if Sion's opponent is clever enough to take advantage of this, there is no chance Sion can scale into the threat his team needs him to be unless Sion's team deliberately goes out of their way to protect him.  If the enemy team doesn't allow Sion to scale into the threat his team needs, he remains marginal.  These tactics to subdue him are simple and effective, anyone with knowledge and patience can pull it off.

Could you tell me what you build for Sion (with cinder)?

I prefer to give him a little bit of damage and lifesteal for his passive through {{item:3071}} and {{item:3074}}, but of course that hits his armor and magic resistance (usually Sion has enough health to disregard that though). Honestly. Nothing really has changed. Select tanks got minor buffs, jungle tanks got a new item. Tanks have the same problems they did before. They're just as vulnerable now than ever. 

-Buy penetration items
-Buy %HP items
-Don't cluster together in teamfights so you can be easily chain CC'd
-Learn to kite-- most tanks don't have the tools to catch people easily
-Ward up so you can avoid an easy initiation by the enemy tank
-Don't focus them, obviously
-Bait out their moves. Tanks still have long CDs with punishing mana costs.
-If they're jungling, steal their buffs. Ever play Amumu without blue? 
-Buy tenacity and slow resistance. I realize Swiftness isn't a popular choice, but against someone like Sej it'll make all the difference.

Tanks have been dumped on for three seasons now. While I love the tank meta, as a tank player, I still think there's a lot of room for improvement.

Do you realize how absurdly vague this is? This could be used to describe 90% of the botlane supports. They bring stuff to the team, that's their deal. They set others up for success. The answer is to kill the teammates they're supporting.

Yes and no.

You want to peel Leona.

You want to kill Sona if you expect an extended siege situation so she can't sustain her allies. Or you want to kill her if you have a great initiation but the carry has defensive options and she's the easier target. Else you risk her counter-engaging with her ult and peeling for her AD carry.

But yes you want to deal with tanks because they set up others for success. The difference comes in which tank or support you're dealing with. 

I hardly see how ''Peel the tank'' is more absurdly vague then ''Don't focus the tank''.

A lot of the counterplay you listed there (besides the itemization) requires more skill to do successfully than it takes to dive into a teamfight with a tank. Tanks are pretty strong right now, and they are mostly easy to play.

Did you not read the thread? Tanks aren't strong right now. Select JUNGLE tanks who synergize really with CInderhulk (AoE + HP scaling) are doing really well. Which doesn't mean a whole lot considering those same tanks were doing really well before. Nothing, absolutely nothing, has been done for tanks (as a whole) to make them better than they were a patch before. 

Counterplay is counterplay. It doesn't take Diamond level understanding of the game to realize that if you don't clump, Amumu/Malph/Sej ults won't matter. I'm not disagreeing that tanks aren't easy to play, but this idea that they're hard to counter is absurd. They're the most easily countered class in the entire game.

I just love how riot says they want to promote diversity, yet they have no clue how to balance at all.  They nerf all mid and top laners, nerf all early game junglers,  nerf snowballing, and call that diversity. All theyre doing is making it to where your team is at a disadvantage if you don't have a tank jungler that can utilize cinderhulk. Basically, all youre gonna see now are tank junglers with heavy cc. I've pretty much given up on this game ever being completely balanced
